amalgamation

noun
combination of companies into one
7.50.3/m

A joining of two or more groups into one

Examples

The amalgamation of companies
After a lengthy negotiation, the amalgamation was finally approved by both companies' boards.
Industry experts analyzed the effects of the recent amalgamation on consumer choice and pricing.
The amalgamation of the two banks created one of the largest financial institutions in the country.
The amalgamation of the two schools created a larger and more diverse student body.
Cultural amalgamation can lead to new traditions and shared values in a community.
The amalgamation of different musical styles resulted in a unique sound.

Synonyms

  • merger
    3.99/m
    Join two or more companies or organizations into a single legal entity
    vsamalgamation: the act or process of joining two or more companies, organizations, or entities into one
  • consolidation
    5.52/m
    Combine parts into a single, more effective or coherent whole
    vsamalgamation: the act or process of combining two or more things into a single, more effective or coherent whole
  • incorporation
    4.90.8/m
    Include or bring parts together to form one complete whole
    vsamalgamation: the act of combining or including things to form a single whole or entity
  • coalescence
    7.80.07/m
    Elements come together naturally to form a single whole
    vsamalgamation: the process of coming together to form one whole or group; the uniting of different elements or parts into a single entity
  • uniting
    3.50.1/m
    Join separate people, things, or organizations into a single group or unit
    vsamalgamation: the act of joining or combining separate people, things, or organizations into one
  • unification
    4.31/m
    Bring separate groups or systems together to form a single unit
    vsamalgamation: the act or process of bringing separate things, people, or groups together to form a single unit or whole
  • fusion
    4.12/m
    Join or blend different things to create a new, mixed result
    vsamalgamation: the process or result of joining or combining two or more things into one (such as in music, cuisine, or general use)

Related Terms

  • synonym: combination - the act of joining or mixing together
  • synonym: merger - the joining together of two or more companies, organizations, or businesses into one
  • antonym: separation - the act of moving things apart or keeping them apart
